name: Courtyard by Marriott Little Rock Downtown

reviews.title: Great Location, Nice Hotel.
reviews.text: I chose the Courtyard Little Rock for its proximity to the Convention Center where I was attending an event. The Courtyard was pleasantly decorated and a little more upscale than I anticipated. There is a hotel bar off the lobby with nice decor and a little area where the breakfast buffet is served.

The breakfast is not included in the room rate here as it is in some Courtyards. The cost is about $9 per person and includes cooked-to-order eggs, make your own waffles, as well as buffet-style sausage, scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, cold cereals, hot cereals, bagels, bread for toasting. The servers will bring a carafe of coffee to the table which eliminates the necessity of trying to flag down the server for a refill. Good thing, because the service is lackluster at best.
reviews.title: I wanted to stay here forever!

likes.disliked: — heavy and loud hotel room doors

reviews.text: Rooms at the hotel are large and include a King Bed and pull-out sofa. All Marriotts are now non-smoking, so this property is as well. A nice touch is the small refrigerator in the room.
reviews.title: outstanding!

reviews.text: There is a tiny fitness center off the pool area. I just peeked in the door, but it looked well-rounded with treadmills, weights,etc.
reviews.title: Loved it
Rude Customer Service
reviews.text: The indoor pool and spa are small, but the kids who were swimming didn't seem to mind.

reviews.title: Cool Courtyard in Little Rock!
reviews.text: Recently stayed at the new Marriott Courtyard in downtown Little Rock Arkansas. I was impressed with the new room design and really hope this will be the new room set up for all future courtyards. The bedding was on par with a 4 star hotel and not the old "apartment rental style" furniture where the sheets slide off the bed when you sit down. The main wall in the room was a long desk that also offered a place for the coffee maker and fridge along with designer lighting. This location was great (you can walk to shops, eats, the riverfront and the Clinton Library)and the staff was friendly. There was a charge for parking and this courtyard does not offer the free breakfast found at other courtyards.

reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel the nights of September 17th & 18th. We were very happy with the location as it is easy walking distance to the Clinton Library and the Riverwalk with all of it's restaurants & bars.

reviews.title: Very nice, hard to beat..
reviews.text: We did have some problems after checking in as we found we had been given a smoking room when our booking guaranteed a non-smoking room. So double check that! We were able to change but with a bit of a struggle.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Little Rock Downtown Hotel
